info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 2:35PM EST until December 22 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG WINTER STORM WILL CREATE MULTIPLE HAZARDS ACROSS THE REGION... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO NOON EST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph are expected on Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * WHERE...In Pennsylvania, higher elevations of Fayette and higher elevations of Westmoreland Counties. In West Virginia, eastern Preston County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to Noon EST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Strong winds will produce minor damage to trees and power lines, possibly resulting in scattered power outages. Winds may gust over 40 mph Friday afternoon through Saturday evening.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Persons are urged to stay indoors until conditions improve. If you must go outside, dress in layers. Several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Cover exposed skin to reduce your risk of frostbite or hypothermia. Gloves, a scarf, and a hat will keep you from losing your body heat. Wrap pipes with insulation and seal windows to avoid loss of heat from your home. Keep a slow steady stream of water running from indoor faucets, and open cabinet doors to allow warm air to circulate around inside pipes. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
